senses.lear_examp: Those extra calories, the fat and salt in our food and the decrease in vitamin rich food, impacts on our health.

senses.sense: to put someone in prison or keep them as a prisoner
senses.dict_examp: Taylor was imprisoned in 2005 for burglary.
senses.lear_examp: DMX was a criminal and was imprisoned.

senses.sense: not affected by a particular type of behavior or emotion
senses.dict_examp: He is immune to flattery.
senses.lear_examp: Bad news on the other hand is so common that in order to cope with it, we simply ignore it - we have become immune to bad news, and television, radio stations and newspapers are aware of it.

senses.sense: not showing any interest or feeling
senses.dict_examp: He sent me a cold and impersonal letter.
senses.lear_examp: To sum up, the only thing we can do is to find out a way to survive in such an impersonal working environment and create a more friendly and intimate atmosphere as before.

senses.sense: to suggest or show something, without saying it directly
senses.dict_examp: He implied (that) the error was mine.
senses.lear_examp: I am not implying that the other options will not be to our advantage but I think that this one is what we really need.

senses.sense:
to involve
 something as a necessary part or condition
senses.dict_examp: Democracy implies free elections.
senses.lear_examp: Such mergers do unfortunately imply a massive loss of jobs, not only in Europe but also all over the world.

senses.sense: used to show that the name of something tells you something about it
senses.dict_examp: A "suggested price" is, as the name implies, the sale price suggested by the manufacturer.
senses.lear_examp: Sour Sweet, as the name implies, is originally a Chinese restaurant.

senses.sense: better than before
senses.dict_examp: A new and improved version of this software was released last week.
senses.lear_examp: The improved economic condition gave us the possibility to buy one or more cars for each family and this results in other big problems.

senses.sense: an idea, feeling or opinion about something or someone
senses.dict_examp: I get the impression that he’s rather shy.
senses.lear_examp: You can look back fifty years to get an impression of what changes have happened.

senses.sense: the way that something seems, looks or feels to a particular person
senses.dict_examp: All our warnings made little impression on him.
senses.lear_examp: I was afraid of being late or saying something wrong because I really wanted to make a good impression on this man.

senses.sense: to think or understand a particular stated thing
senses.dict_examp: I was under the impression (that) you didn't get on too well.
senses.lear_examp: I am under the impression that people generally exercise a little, but if they eat the wrong food every day, it won't help.

senses.sense: to cause someone to admire or respect you
senses.dict_examp: She impressed us with her sincerity.
senses.lear_examp: All groups did their best to impress the public and every group played professionally.

senses.sense: to get better or to make something better
senses.dict_examp: Her health has improved.
senses.lear_examp: I always love studying History and I'm sure I will improve my vocabulary and English Grammar.

senses.sense: to create a rule, tax, law, etc., and force people to accept it
senses.dict_examp: The city imposed a ban on outdoor water use during the drought.
senses.lear_examp: First of all, I believe that the local administration should impose some sort of regulations, so that the traditional architecture will be respected.

senses.sense: to force someone to accept something, especially a belief or way of living
senses.dict_examp: Settlers often imposed their culture on indigenous peoples.
senses.lear_examp: Above all, never allow others to impose their ideas on you.

senses.sense: when someone is impatient
senses.dict_examp: His impatience was obvious.
senses.lear_examp: She remained silent for a while, taking no notice of my growing impatience.

senses.sense: a sudden feeling that you must do something, without thinking about the results
senses.dict_examp: Her first impulse was to run away.
senses.lear_examp: He is, therefore, a sort of intellectual and represents the force of reason as opposed to the violent impulses of the other boys.

senses.sense: suddenly and without thinking first
senses.dict_examp: I tend to act on impulse.
senses.lear_examp: I'm seeing Milly as a capricious girl who, like most teenagers, enjoys buying, although I think that she buys on impulse.

senses.sense: the action of putting someone in prison, or keeping someone in prison
senses.dict_examp: We were shocked by the imprisonment of the young students.
senses.lear_examp: The reason for More's imprisonment was his refusing to swear to the Act of Succession.

senses.sense: to buy or bring in products from another country
senses.dict_examp: We import a large number of cars from Japan.
senses.lear_examp: Moreover they say we must be independent of the Near East countries from whom we import oil.

senses.sense: a product that is imported from another country
senses.dict_examp: food/oil imports
senses.lear_examp: In my opinion, one of the reasons for these changes is that our country became wealthier after World War II, which led to an increase in food imports.

senses.sense: the activity of importing something into a country
senses.dict_examp: The FDA oversees the import of seafood, fruits, and vegetables.
senses.lear_examp: One of them, which is the most important for a government, is the import of foreign money.

senses.sense: in a way that is important
senses.dict_examp: She has a pleasant personality, but more importantly, she is well qualified for the job.
senses.lear_examp: Lastly, and most importantly, what is the cost?

senses.sense: not perfect and with some mistakes
senses.dict_examp: an imperfect solution
senses.lear_examp: It goes without saying that native speakers are the best to talk to when learning the language (of course, if they don't mind your practicing your imperfect English on them.)

senses.sense: the cells and other parts of the body that work together to protect the body against infection
senses.dict_examp: Healthy eating will help boost your immune system.
senses.lear_examp: When you have lupus, your immune system produces antibodies against your own vital organs.

senses.sense: in an impatient way
senses.dict_examp: "Yes, you said that before," she said, impatiently.
senses.lear_examp: I hope you will come soon because we are all impatiently waiting for your talk.

senses.sense: not polite
senses.dict_examp: It is impolite to point at people.
senses.lear_examp: Besides, the serving speed was too slow and some waiters were even impolite to customers.

senses.sense: valuable, useful or necessary
senses.dict_examp: It’s important to tell the doctor all your symptoms.
senses.lear_examp: This is not important for me.

senses.sense: having a lot of power, influence or effect
senses.dict_examp: He was one of the most important writers of that period.
senses.lear_examp: Tom was a director of a very important company in Mexico.

senses.sense: a result or effect that seems likely in the future
senses.dict_examp: What are the implications of the new regulations?
senses.lear_examp: Another implication of this fashion change in Japanese society is perhaps the liberation of our spirits.

senses.sense: a suggestion of something that you make without saying it directly
senses.dict_examp: The implication was that the school had to do much better or it would be closed.
senses.lear_examp: In spite of that, the implication that famous sportsmen are worth paying more than other famous people, for example well-known scientists, is an over-simplification.

senses.sense: the involvement of someone with something bad
senses.dict_examp: His career was ruined by his implication in the financial scandal.
senses.lear_examp: I even thought that the maid could have taken it off my desk and used it as fuel for the boiler, but I checked with her and she denied any implication in the disappearance of the diary.

senses.sense: easily annoyed by someone's mistakes or because you have to wait
senses.dict_examp: He's a good teacher, but he can be impatient with slow learners.
senses.lear_examp: Hours passed and she became impatient and thought he had forgotten about their date.

senses.sense: wanting something to happen as soon as possible
senses.dict_examp: He's got a lot of exciting ideas and he's impatient to get started.
senses.lear_examp: I'm impatient to discover this country.

senses.sense: suggested but not stated directly
senses.dict_examp: an implicit threat
senses.lear_examp: There was an implicit social code, which influenced people's relationships.

senses.sense: If an action or event is impossible, it cannot happen or be done.
senses.dict_examp: It’s almost impossible to get them to agree on anything.
senses.lear_examp: I tried to find it but it was impossible!

senses.sense: very difficult to deal with
senses.dict_examp: Traffic at rush hour is just impossible.
senses.lear_examp: I couldn't help laughing at the impossible situation that had resulted from the combination of my personal musings by the side of this wishing-well, and the boy's very straightforward and impulsive character.

senses.sense: how important someone or something is
senses.dict_examp: Your views are of great importance to us.
senses.lear_examp: Now I know the importance of electricity.

senses.sense: Someone or something that is impressive makes you admire and respect them.
senses.dict_examp: She's a very impressive public speaker.
senses.lear_examp: I think that the Westfield Music Festival was really impressive.

senses.sense: when something is impossible
senses.dict_examp: What you're asking just can't be done - it's an impossibility.
senses.lear_examp: Simple tasks like watching television or listening to music become an impossibility when every five minutes or so they get drowned in a sea of noise.

senses.sense: the process of putting a plan or system is put into operation
senses.dict_examp: Implementation of the new computer system went smoothly.
senses.lear_examp: I think that the development and implementation of new energy-saving technologies may contribute significantly to the prevention of further air, water and soil pollution.

senses.sense: progress in becoming better, or when something has been made better
senses.dict_examp: We are seeing significant improvements in test scores.
senses.lear_examp: Just twenty to thirty minutes riding every day gives you a considerable improvement in your general state of health.

senses.sense: a change to something that makes it better
senses.dict_examp: home/road/transportation improvements
senses.lear_examp: It is very important to make improvements to the student library in our college.

senses.sense: to make an idea, system, law, plan, etc., start to happen or operate
senses.dict_examp: The bill that would implement tax reforms was not passed.
senses.lear_examp: Rare species protection, on the other hand, can be implemented, e.g., by means of wildlife reserves and national parks.

senses.sense: feeling admiration or respect for someone or something
senses.dict_examp: I was impressed by her professionalism.
senses.lear_examp: I am really impressed by your offer to paint me.

senses.sense: the form of a verb which is usually used for giving orders
senses.dict_examp: In the phrase "Leave him alone," the verb "leave" is an imperative/is in the imperative.

senses.sense: When an action or process is imperative, it is extremely important that it happens or is done.
senses.dict_examp: It is imperative (that) I speak with him at once.
senses.lear_examp: It was imperative to see her father again and confront him with the truth.

senses.sense: a sudden feeling that you must do something, without thinking about the results
senses.dict_examp: Her first impulse was to run away.
senses.lear_examp: He is, therefore, a sort of intellectual and represents the force of reason as opposed to the violent impulses of the other boys.

senses.sense: suddenly and without thinking first
senses.dict_examp: I tend to act on impulse.
senses.lear_examp: I'm seeing Milly as a capricious girl who, like most teenagers, enjoys buying, although I think that she buys on impulse.

senses.sense: Impulsive people do things suddenly, without planning or thinking carefully, because they want to.
senses.dict_examp: I thought she seemed very bright, but also impulsive and unpredictable.
senses.lear_examp: On the other hand Lily is more impulsive and energetic. At the beginning she reacts better than Mui because she faces straight away the problems.

senses.sense: inside or toward the inside of a container, place or area
senses.dict_examp: There's milk in the refrigerator.
senses.lear_examp: He works in Austria now.

senses.sense: during part or all of a period of time
senses.dict_examp: We're going to Italy in April.
senses.lear_examp: I like my country in March because spring is coming.

senses.sense: needing or using no more time than a particular amount of time
senses.dict_examp: Can you finish the job in two weeks?
senses.lear_examp: We can  finish in two days.

senses.sense: forming a part of something
senses.dict_examp: He used to be the lead singer in a rock band.
senses.lear_examp: My sister sings in a pop group.

senses.sense: close to the front part of something or where someone can see or hear you
senses.dict_examp: He parked the car in front of the house.
senses.lear_examp: We can meet in front of the museum.

senses.sense: wearing
senses.dict_examp: Do you recognize that man in the grey suit?
senses.lear_examp: The man has to be dressed in black.

senses.sense: early or at the right time
senses.dict_examp: We arrived in time to catch the train.
senses.lear_examp: If I don't come back in time you can put a note on my desk.

senses.sense: before a particular time, or before doing a particular thing
senses.dict_examp: If you're going to come, please let me know in advance.
senses.lear_examp: I can help you if you want to book your room in advance.

senses.sense: used to emphasize what is really true, or to give more information
senses.dict_examp: We met Rebecca for lunch. In fact, we spent the whole afternoon with her.
senses.lear_examp: The club has its own small clubhouse, with many things in it. For example, there was a big pinball-game and some computers.  In fact it was the best clubhouse I've ever seen.

senses.sense: further forward than someone or something else
senses.dict_examp: The car in front suddenly stopped and I ran into the back of it.
senses.lear_examp: As the concert finished, I heard someone call my name. I believed it was my imagination or perhaps a dream because I couldn't see anyone in front, behind or opposite me.

senses.sense: liking someone very much and having romantic or sexual feelings for them
senses.dict_examp: Have you ever been in love?
senses.lear_examp: I think I am in love with him.

senses.sense: experiencing an emotion or condition
senses.dict_examp: She's in a bad/good mood this morning.
senses.lear_examp: I hope you are in a good mood today, because we are planning to go to Cinepolis.

senses.sense: arranged or divided in a particular way
senses.dict_examp: We all sat down in a circle.
senses.lear_examp: We often work in groups where we can talk in English.

senses.sense: as well (as)
senses.dict_examp: In addition to his flat in London, he has a villa in Italy and a castle in Scotland.
senses.lear_examp: And in addition, I'm going to paint a few pictures for my room, I like painting very much!

senses.sense: finally, after something has been thought about or discussed a lot
senses.dict_examp: We were thinking about going to Switzerland, but in the end we went to Austria.
senses.lear_examp: He wrote me about his plans for the future but in the end he invited me to go to France with him.

senses.sense: including or considering all the information about something or every part of something
senses.dict_examp: We haven't discussed the matter in detail yet.
senses.lear_examp: I'm really sorry that I didn't write back earlier, but to make up for this I will answer your questions in detail!

senses.sense: completely and with nothing missing
senses.dict_examp: The bill must be paid in full by the end of the month.
senses.lear_examp: On the whole, I would like to say that the lessons together with the social events will show daily life at my school in full.

senses.sense: beginning from now
senses.dict_examp: Could you be more careful in the future?
senses.lear_examp: I hope to see it again and I'll be more careful in the future with my objects.

senses.sense: usually, or in most situations
senses.dict_examp: In general, men are taller than women.
senses.lear_examp: In general I like reading in my free time, when I have nothing to do...

senses.sense: crying
senses.dict_examp: I found him in tears in his bedroom.
senses.lear_examp: By the end of it, Mary Anne was nearly in tears.

senses.sense: with the purpose of achieving something
senses.dict_examp: He came home early in order to see the children before they went to bed.
senses.lear_examp: She will go to the United States in order to improve her English.

senses.sense: expressed or written in a particular way
senses.dict_examp: They spoke in Russian the whole time.
senses.lear_examp: I also speak in English during the break.

senses.sense: especially
senses.dict_examp: Are you looking for anything in particular?
senses.lear_examp: I've read a lot of books recently, and in particular I liked: "Eleven minutes" and "Veronica decides to die", written by Paulo Coelho.

senses.sense: involved or connected with a particular subject or activity
senses.dict_examp: a degree in philosophy
senses.lear_examp: He is my age and we have the same tastes in music and art.

senses.sense: because of a possibility of something happening, being needed, etc.
senses.dict_examp: I don't think I'll need any money but I'll bring some just in case.
senses.lear_examp: You can't forget to bring comfortable shoes in case you have to walk long distances while you are sightseeing.

senses.sense: when something happens, or in preparation for when something happens
senses.dict_examp: We keep a bucket of water backstage, in case of fire.
senses.lear_examp: It is about how to rescue people in case of an accident or a natural disaster.

senses.sense: considering the whole of someone or something, and not just a particular part of them
senses.dict_examp: So, apart from the bad ankle, how are you in general?
senses.lear_examp: I think that I, as well as people in general, would have been more depressed if we didn't have light.

senses.sense: to agree with or approve of a plan or idea
senses.dict_examp: Most people are in favor of reducing traffic in cities.
senses.lear_examp: I am more in favor of longer opening hours during the week, and of shorter ones on the weekend.

senses.sense: divided into two equal parts
senses.dict_examp: Cut the potatoes in two.
senses.lear_examp: They were very surprised when they found the gold was cut in half.

senses.sense: used to emphasize what is really true, or to give more information
senses.dict_examp: I thought she was Portuguese, but in actual fact she's Brazilian.
senses.lear_examp: Nowadays almost all people own a car and in actual fact more and more people have been facing death as a consequence of careless driving.

senses.sense: used to give another reason for something you are saying, or that you have done
senses.dict_examp: I don't want to go and in any case, I haven't been invited.
senses.lear_examp: In any case I will meet you at the opening party at the end of the month.

senses.sense: because of the mentioned situation
senses.dict_examp: There's no coffee left? In that case I'll have tea.
senses.lear_examp: You could try kayaking. In that case, of course, you need to pay for the equipment.

senses.sense: used to show the total amount of something
senses.dict_examp: Some of the children came, so there were 15 of us in all.
senses.lear_examp: Secondly, even though most people liked the group RADIANT, they only played for 35 minutes in all.

senses.sense: used when referring to something that is done as a result of something else
senses.dict_examp: I'd like to do something for you in return/exchange for everything you've done for me.
senses.lear_examp: I am writing to you in response to your advertisement of 1st December in the Times.

senses.sense: using only a few words
senses.dict_examp: world news in brief
senses.lear_examp: Now I will tell you in brief what exactly happened to me.

senses.sense: in someone's opinion
senses.dict_examp: In my parents' eyes, I'll always be a child.
senses.lear_examp: To answer your question right away, the boat trip is highly recommendable in my eyes!

senses.sense: used to introduce the last part of a speech or a piece of writing
senses.dict_examp: In conclusion, I would like to thank our guest speaker for her fascinating talk.
senses.lear_examp: In conclusion, music, TV and clothes are very important in a young person's life and can reflect each person's character.

senses.sense: used to say what something is about
senses.dict_examp: I am writing in connection with the above job advertised in The Daily Press on Monday 12th February.
senses.lear_examp: Dear Mrs Brown, I am writing in connection with a surprise birthday party for your husband, Mr Brown.

senses.sense: at a suitable time in the future
senses.dict_examp: The results will be sent to you in due course.
senses.lear_examp: I look forward to hearing from you in due course.

senses.sense: toward someone
senses.dict_examp: She keeps looking in my direction.
senses.lear_examp: I didn't know why she was talking to me but suddenly she walked in my direction and told me: "I need to know your name".

senses.sense: used to explain what something means in a different way
senses.dict_examp: He said he's too busy - in other words he isn't interested.
senses.lear_examp: They had had a great time before and had drunk too much alcohol. In other words, they were totally drunk.

senses.sense: An agreement that is in writing is official and is proof of that agreement.
senses.dict_examp: Please confirm your reservation in writing.
senses.lear_examp: I am telling you in writing that I would like to help you.

senses.sense: if vegetables or fruit are in season, they are available and ready to eat.
senses.dict_examp: Asparagus is in season at the moment.
senses.lear_examp: They celebrate Halloween in October when pumpkins are in season, that's why in the decorations they include them very often; most of the people carve the pumpkins and put some lights inside.

senses.sense: without telling other people
senses.dict_examp: For years they met in secret.
senses.lear_examp: We met in secret when Mary was busy.

senses.sense: feeling good/excited/unhappy, etc.
senses.dict_examp: The whole class was in good spirits that day.
senses.lear_examp: I was in high spirits until I got my paper back.

senses.sense: because of
senses.dict_examp: In view of recent events, we have decided to cancel the meeting.
senses.lear_examp: In view of what happened, I would advise you not to try to mislead people like this again.

senses.sense: in order to celebrate or show great respect for someone or something
senses.dict_examp: a banquet in honor of the president
senses.lear_examp: Besides, if you come these days you will see the local fiesta at which the local people celebrate special events in honor of our saints.

senses.sense: If you do something in person, you go somewhere to do it yourself.
senses.dict_examp: You have to collect the document in person.
senses.lear_examp: I am looking forward to meeting you in person.

senses.sense: instead of something
senses.dict_examp: Try adding fruit to your cereal in place of sugar.
senses.lear_examp: In the advertisement, it said that Danny Brook was starring, but in place of him there was a different actor and he was really disappointing.

senses.sense: at the start of a situation
senses.dict_examp: Why did you invite her in the first place?
senses.lear_examp: In the first place, you were unknown people for me, but now you are my special foreign friends.

senses.sense: If something is true in practice, this is the real situation.
senses.dict_examp: In practice, the new laws have had little effect.
senses.lear_examp: When you leave school, you have knowledge but you do not know how to use it in practice.

senses.sense: in a place where nobody else can hear you or see what you are doing
senses.dict_examp: The meeting was held in private.
senses.lear_examp: I agree that this should be in private.

senses.sense: happening or being done now
senses.dict_examp: Repair work is in progress on the south-bound lane of the motorway and will continue until June.
senses.lear_examp: In the lower part of your advertisement, it also said there was a theatre restaurant, but in fact, it was closed because internal decoration was in progress.

senses.sense: when compared with something
senses.dict_examp: Salaries are low in relation to the cost of living.
senses.lear_examp: I think television has several advantages but also disadvantages in relation to books.

senses.sense: about or relating to something
senses.dict_examp: I'd like to ask you something in relation to what you said earlier.
senses.lear_examp: In relation to last month's social program, the sightseeing tour of London was divine, although we didn't get to see the entire city.

senses.sense: in a particular way, or in many ways
senses.dict_examp: The school has changed in many respects.
senses.lear_examp: How's your friend Mike? He is in many respects better than a computer, isn't he? (Teasing you again, sorry).

senses.sense: as an answer to
senses.dict_examp: I'm writing in response to your letter of February 14.
senses.lear_examp: I am writing in response to your advertisement, which appeared in the newspaper on November the 23rd, looking for a person to work at weekends in your cafe.

senses.sense: one after another without a break
senses.dict_examp: He's just won the tournament for the fifth year in a row.
senses.lear_examp: Maradona was the captain of the team, and since he arrived, the team won three championships in a row.

senses.sense: available in a store or other place
senses.dict_examp: Do you have the book in stock?
senses.lear_examp: Shopping could be annoying if you look at it as a waste of time because you do it every day.  Reorganize your behavior when shopping and plan to keep food in stock!

senses.sense: in the way described by a rule, law, or wish
senses.dict_examp: Both companies have insisted that they were acting in accordance with the law.
senses.lear_examp: Although they do not earn much money in this profession, they try to do their best and judge in accordance with the law which they also have to interpret.

senses.sense: working together with
senses.dict_examp: The event was organized in association with the Student Council.
senses.lear_examp: This service, which will be provided in association with Foster Loft, will be available at the end of 2005.

senses.sense: in large amounts
senses.dict_examp: to buy in bulk
senses.lear_examp: I suggest that you buy food in bulk so that you not only save money but also save time.

senses.sense: if something happens
senses.dict_examp: An airbag could save your life in the event of an accident.
senses.lear_examp: In the event of bad weather, it would be wise to plan an alternative to the boat trip, for example a visit of Buckingham Palace or the Houses of Parliament.

senses.sense: whatever happens
senses.dict_examp: I'm not sure if I'm coming on Friday, but in any event, I'll see you next week.
senses.lear_examp: In any event, it is incumbent upon all of us to carefully plan our travel matters, so as to take advantage of their several benefits.

senses.sense: the particular way in which something appears or exists
senses.dict_examp: The novel is written in the form of a series of letters.
senses.lear_examp: For all this, I can only say that I want my money back immediately, or some compensation in the form of a real trip to a real country.

senses.sense: used to say what you really feel or think
senses.dict_examp: In his heart, he knew she was right.
senses.lear_examp: I have to admit that it was only a sensible decision, because deep in my heart I knew I wanted to learn English.

senses.sense: because you want something good to happen
senses.dict_examp: She went to Paris in the hope of improving her French.
senses.lear_examp: Dear Dave Bennington, I am writing to you in the hope that you will attend our next event in July.

senses.sense: to help someone and give them an advantage
senses.dict_examp: It may not be in your interest to change jobs so soon.
senses.lear_examp: It is in my interests to meet new people and I find it easy to go and talk to people I do not know.

senses.sense: If something is done or happens in the light of facts, it is done or happens because of those facts.
senses.dict_examp: In  light of                     the problems we’re having, we have no choice but to close the business.
senses.lear_examp: In light of all the things mentioned above, I strongly recommend Alexandra for the job.

senses.sense: to be lucky or to be able to have or do what you want
senses.dict_examp: "Do you have any tuna sandwiches?" "You're in luck - there's one left."
senses.lear_examp: I was in luck, because my friend, who lived in the same area, had his private car and gave me a lift every day.

senses.sense: If you do something in moderation, you do not do it too much.
senses.dict_examp: I only drink alcohol in moderation.
senses.lear_examp: While shopping can make one feel good and even has its positive impact on the retail economy, I think it should be done in moderation.

senses.sense: something that you say when you are describing something using as few words as possible
senses.dict_examp: The answer, in a nutshell, is yes.
senses.lear_examp: To put it in a nutshell, they all provide good food at reasonable prices.

senses.sense: approximately
senses.dict_examp: It probably cost somewhere in the region of £900.
senses.lear_examp: I am willing to pay rent in the region of £1000 to £1200 monthly.

senses.sense: ready to be used if or when you need it
senses.dict_examp: She keeps a little money in reserve.
senses.lear_examp: It would be an idea to have some activity in reserve if you have to cancel something, such as the boat trip on the Thames.

senses.sense: very soon
senses.dict_examp: We'll be home in no time.
senses.lear_examp: Team work is very important for us and you will make many friends in no time.

senses.sense: singing or playing the right notes
senses.dict_examp: Try to stay in tune.
senses.lear_examp: The public was singing in tune with Jag, hands were raised and bodies were slowly swaying.

senses.sense: as a result of something that is part of a series of events
senses.dict_examp: This could result in the loss of certain species of fish and this in turn poses a serious threat to the fishing communities along the river banks.
senses.lear_examp: This, in turn, enabled them to find jobs and become financially independent from their husbands.

senses.sense: one after the other in an agreed order
senses.dict_examp: She spoke to each of the guests in turn.
senses.lear_examp: We had two different teachers in the mornings and in the afternoons, in turn.

senses.sense: without any success
senses.dict_examp: I tried in vain to start a conversation.
senses.lear_examp: We looked in vain for the guide through three London parks.

senses.sense: not at all
senses.dict_examp: This is in no way your fault.
senses.lear_examp: This magazine will be loved by students as it will help them learn English in the best way and in no way will students find it boring.

senses.sense: being cared for or dealt with by someone skilled
senses.dict_examp: The project is in safe hands - Jan has lots of experience.
senses.lear_examp: He has also been trained as a lifeguard so the residents of your hotel would probably be in safe hands.

senses.sense: similarly
senses.dict_examp: In the same way, there are many citizens who feel unprotected by the police.
senses.lear_examp: In the same way, grandmothers may be shocked when seeing their little children wearing extravagant clothes or really short skirts.

senses.sense: thinking about something in a particular way
senses.dict_examp: In a sense, he's right.
senses.lear_examp: In a sense this is correct, since you have to leave your natural environment to visit a place where no human being is meant to survive.

senses.sense: in a few words
senses.dict_examp: In short, we need more staff.
senses.lear_examp: In short, ancient Chinese poems, mainly from the Jang Dynasty, constitute the background for Chinese culture and set a touchstone for judgement in our life.

senses.sense: going to happen soon
senses.dict_examp: You never know what's in store for you.
senses.lear_examp: Nobody knows what the future will have in store!

senses.sense: expecting something to happen or in preparation for something happening
senses.dict_examp: She's even decorated the spare room in anticipation of your visit.
senses.lear_examp: This has sometimes resulted in the comic phenomenon of people traveling to a distant country, in anticipation of encountering strange and original lifestyles, only to come across situations not very different from the one they have left in their own countries.

senses.sense: present at an event
senses.dict_examp: They have doctors in attendance at every match.
senses.lear_examp: Professional coaches are in attendance and the members can have proper lessons.

senses.sense: to feel great respect for and sometimes fear of someone
senses.dict_examp: As children we were rather in awe of our grandfather.
senses.lear_examp: As I was the eldest of the siblings, they used to respect all my orders and even now, they are a bit in awe of me.

senses.sense: as well as everything else
senses.dict_examp: Caffeine has no good effects on health and is mildly addictive in the bargain.
senses.lear_examp: More or less few people are, in the bargain, prepared to adapt themselves to the others in order to be accepted.

senses.sense: extremely quickly
senses.dict_examp: In the blink of an eye, he was gone.
senses.lear_examp: I got dressed in the blink of an eye and I got down to the kitchen almost rolling down the stairs.

senses.sense: to be in the same unpleasant situation as other people
senses.dict_examp: She complains that she doesn't have enough money, but we're all in the same boat.
senses.lear_examp: Unemployment and its consequences is still a major problem. Now we are in the same boat.

senses.sense: not knowing about something because other people are not telling you
senses.dict_examp: They kept us in the dark about their plans.
senses.lear_examp: Peter had always kept her in the dark about the reason for their fight.

senses.sense: wanted or needed in large numbers
senses.dict_examp: Good teachers are always in demand.
senses.lear_examp: Many goods are not in demand because each family produces its own goods.

senses.sense: used to say what the real situation is
senses.dict_examp: This means, in effect, that the plan has been scrapped.
senses.lear_examp: However, if the government increases the amount of money they pay to the unemployed, that in effect means higher taxes for the citizens which will cause strikes and various other problems.

senses.sense: used to emphasize the most important idea or quality of something
senses.dict_examp: In essence, its purpose is to contain information.
senses.lear_examp: In essence, homelessness means that you don't have a home and because of this you are living on the streets.

senses.sense: while having to deal with a difficult situation or problem
senses.dict_examp: They left home in the face of strong opposition from their families.
senses.lear_examp: No doubt, it was rather difficult to like Enid X. She was hardly likely to arouse sympathy in anybody even in the face of death.

senses.sense: in a difficult situation that causes you trouble or problems
senses.dict_examp: He’s in a fix and needs our help.
senses.lear_examp: She felt happy when I was down in the dumps or in a fix and kept on being jealous of me concerning trivial matters.

senses.sense: immediately, or very quickly
senses.dict_examp: I'll be back in a flash.
senses.lear_examp: He took it and, in a flash, he came up to the surface.

senses.sense: If a law, rule, etc. is in force, it exists and is being used.
senses.dict_examp: New regulations limiting fishing on this river are now in force.
senses.lear_examp: Because the measures are only in Patra they are not very powerful because it isn't an official law so that it is always in force.

senses.sense: being worked on or dealt with now
senses.dict_examp: Don't worry – we have the situation  in hand.
senses.lear_examp: Miss Kenton keeps asking Stevens whether everything is in hand and whether her help is required.

senses.sense: used to give your opinion about something, often when you are sure you are right
senses.dict_examp: In my humble opinion, that's the wrong decision.
senses.lear_examp: In my humble opinion, there's no such thing as a uniform celebrity, good, bad or otherwise.

senses.sense: Something that is in its infancy has only just begun to develop.
senses.dict_examp: In the 1950s, space travel was in its infancy.

senses.sense: in order to achieve a particular situation or quality
senses.dict_examp: In the interest of safety, passengers are advised to wear their seat belts at all times.
senses.lear_examp: First of all, do make sure that the front door is always locked. In the interests of everybody's security, it is essential to remember this.

senses.sense: alone, or separately from other people, places, or things
senses.dict_examp: These poems cannot be considered in isolation.
senses.lear_examp: In conclusion, it is my opinion that the problem of parking space cannot be solved in isolation.

senses.sense: almost certainly
senses.dict_examp: The facilities are wasted on people who in all likelihood will not use them.
senses.lear_examp: In all likelihood, you will have to work during the weekends, even in summer, so I firmly believe that loving your job is very important.

senses.sense: to be similar to and suitable for something
senses.dict_examp: They were offered a pay increase in line with inflation.
senses.lear_examp: The other two courses, at 5%, are still in line with the national average.

senses.sense: If you do something in memory of a dead person, you do it to show your respect or love for them.
senses.dict_examp: They built a statue in memory of those who died in the fire.
senses.lear_examp: You see, every year our family performs a certain gathering in memory of my brother who was killed in a plane crash in 1991 known as the C130 disaster.

senses.sense: in your imagination or memory
senses.dict_examp: In my mind's eye, I imagined the building painted white, with a beautiful garden around it.
senses.lear_examp: He sees her in his mind's eye, running around barefoot, laughing and squealing, wading in the water and running back out, screaming, trying to get away from the breaking waves.

senses.sense: If something is in miniature, it is a very small copy of something else.
senses.dict_examp: a model of the ship in miniature
senses.lear_examp: Thirdly a co-educational school is a society in miniature and it has many practical advantages.

senses.sense: If bad things are done in the name of something, they are done in order to help that thing succeed.
senses.dict_examp: Are you willing to work yourself to death in the name of competition?
senses.lear_examp: There are things one cannot trifle with: friendship for example should not be sacrificed in the name of success.

senses.sense: combined into a single thing
senses.dict_examp: It's a vacation and art course all in one.
senses.lear_examp: The Internet is like combining a television, a telephone and an airplane all in one.

senses.sense: partly
senses.dict_examp: He is in part to blame for the accident.
senses.lear_examp: Technology is in part to blame.

senses.sense: when things are in perspective, you think about them in a sensible and  realistic way, and understand how important or unimportant they really are
senses.dict_examp: You must keep things in perspective - the overall situation isn't really that bad.
senses.lear_examp: I think it will enable me to see things more in perspective.

senses.sense: in the correct position
senses.dict_examp: The chairs are all in place.
senses.lear_examp: I looked neat and clean even after the wildest games in the school yard, with all the ribbons that tied my long hair in place.

senses.sense: If a rule, system, etc. is in place, it has started to exist.
senses.dict_examp: There are now laws in place to prevent this from happening.
senses.lear_examp: Let's take the example of Mexico City, where such restrictions have been in place since early 2000.

senses.sense: used to mean that something is very likely
senses.dict_examp: She will, in all probability, have left before we arrive.
senses.lear_examp: Anybody who can fulfill the above conditions will in all probability be successful.

senses.sense: If something changes in proportion to another thing, it changes to the same degree as that thing.
senses.dict_examp: Your tax payment increases in proportion to your salary.
senses.lear_examp: One aspect of the question is the fact that a sportsman's salary is supposedly not in proportion to the number of hours he works.

senses.sense: the person or thing that is being discussed
senses.dict_examp: He sais that he was at a restaurant with his friends on the night in question.
senses.lear_examp: While this is not necessarily false, it should be borne in mind that the events in question are by no means boring or uninteresting.

senses.sense: thinking back to something that happened  before
senses.dict_examp: In retrospect, I should probably have told her.
senses.lear_examp: To cut a long story short I decided to go, though half-heartedly as I still had doubts about it. In retrospect, it turned out to be an unforgettable experience.

senses.sense: in a bad situation where you do the same things all the time, or where it is impossible to make progress
senses.dict_examp: He seems to be stuck in a rut at the moment.
senses.lear_examp: Financial security, all the, let me call them, background benefits are important, but if you do not love what you do, soon you will become bitter, stuck in a rut or worse - you will suffer from depression.

senses.sense: to be acceptable in a way that will not upset or anger people
senses.dict_examp: His speech was in good taste.
senses.lear_examp: I therefore thought that it would be in good taste to write about two of them.

senses.sense: to be unacceptable in a way that will upset or anger people
senses.dict_examp: He told a joke about a plane crash which I thought was in rather poor taste.

senses.sense: in a direct and often angry way
senses.dict_examp: I told him to go away in no uncertain terms.
senses.lear_examp: Intellectuals are used to saying in no uncertain terms that money represents the bad side of the sport.

senses.sense: to understand what someone wants or needs or to understand a situation and act in a way that is suitable for it
senses.dict_examp: The congress is not in tune with the voters.
senses.lear_examp: I am not exactly in tune with all the latest trends but I know which styles give me the most satisfaction.

senses.sense: in the area near a place
senses.dict_examp: A number of buildings in the vicinity of the fire were damaged.
senses.lear_examp: Just to briefly introduce myself, my name is Prashant Sharma and I live in the vicinity of the college campus.

senses.sense: used to say that someone or something does something to a large degree
senses.dict_examp: They celebrate birthdays in a big way.
senses.lear_examp: Tourism helps Greece's national economy - which is not at its best - in a big way.

senses.sense: to be likely to happen
senses.dict_examp: Do you think marriage is in the cards?

senses.sense: not in a difficult situation or having problems any more
senses.dict_examp: We had some large debts, but we should be in the clear by next year.
senses.lear_examp: "You're in the clear, you don't have to be afraid any more," it said.

senses.sense: in a cruel way, without showing any emotion
senses.dict_examp: He shot three policemen in cold blood.
senses.lear_examp: Returning to the story, when I arrived, I went directly to Hillton Avenue where I should have met 005, but when I arrived at the meeting point I found him lying on the floor with two shots in his back; he had been murdered in cold blood.

senses.sense: If you tell something to someone in confidence, you do not want them to tell anyone else.
senses.dict_examp: I'm sorry, she told me that in confidence.
senses.lear_examp: His real name isn't Piggy but he told Ralph in confidence that they called him that in school because of his appearance.

senses.sense: working, used, or happening with something or someone else
senses.dict_examp: Our librarians use their knowledge in conjunction with the computer network.
senses.lear_examp: Therefore if the banning of private cars takes place in conjunction with development in the public transportation system in that city, this whole development will have more advantages despite some slight difficulties at the start.

senses.sense: because of or for this reason
senses.dict_examp: This course is good in that it provides a very practical training.
senses.lear_examp: Nowadays it is widely argued that professional sports are damaging to people's health in that they involve grueling training sessions as an integral part of the occupation.

senses.sense: into an area or space from the outside of it
senses.dict_examp: Could you bring the clothes in for me?
senses.lear_examp: First I brought in the big cake that my father had bought.

senses.sense: at the place where a person usually lives or works
senses.dict_examp: Mr Ellis isn't in this week.
senses.lear_examp: We go in at 8:15.

senses.sense: having arrived at the place where people can get on or off
senses.dict_examp: What time is Roz's flight due in?

senses.sense: given or sent to someone official in order to be read
senses.dict_examp: When does your essay have to be in?

senses.sense: the details of a particular subject
senses.dict_examp: the ins and outs of the legal system
senses.lear_examp: I knew all the ins and outs of every story but I couldn't stay one single day in bed without reading it.

senses.sense: inside or toward the inside of a container, place or area

senses.lear_examp: He works in Austria now.

senses.sense: during part or all of a period of time

senses.lear_examp: I like my country in March because spring is coming.

senses.sense: needing or using no more time than a particular amount of time
senses.dict_examp: Can you finish the job in two weeks?
senses.lear_examp: We can  finish in two days.

senses.sense: forming a part of something

senses.lear_examp: My sister sings in a pop group.

senses.sense: close to the front part of something or where someone can see or hear you
senses.dict_examp: He parked the car in front of the house.
senses.lear_examp: We can meet in front of the museum.

senses.sense: wearing
senses.dict_examp: Do you recognize that man in the grey suit?
senses.lear_examp: The man has to be dressed in black.

senses.sense: early or at the right time
senses.dict_examp: We arrived in time to catch the train.
senses.lear_examp: If I don't come back in time you can put a note on my desk.

senses.sense: before a particular time, or before doing a particular thing
senses.dict_examp: If you're going to come, please let me know in advance.
senses.lear_examp: I can help you if you want to book your room in advance.

senses.sense: used to emphasize what is really true, or to give more information
senses.dict_examp: We met Rebecca for lunch. In fact, we spent the whole afternoon with her.
senses.lear_examp: The club has its own small clubhouse, with many things in it. For example, there was a big pinball-game and some computers.  In fact it was the best clubhouse I've ever seen.

senses.sense: further forward than someone or something else

senses.lear_examp: As the concert finished, I heard someone call my name. I believed it was my imagination or perhaps a dream because I couldn't see anyone in front, behind or opposite me.

senses.sense: liking someone very much and having romantic or sexual feelings for them
senses.dict_examp: Have you ever been in love?
senses.lear_examp: I think I am in love with him.

senses.sense: experiencing an emotion or condition

senses.lear_examp: I hope you are in a good mood today, because we are planning to go to Cinepolis.

senses.sense: arranged or divided in a particular way
senses.dict_examp: We all sat down in a circle.
senses.lear_examp: We often work in groups where we can talk in English.

senses.sense: as well (as)
senses.dict_examp: In addition to his flat in London, he has a villa in Italy and a castle in Scotland.
senses.lear_examp: And in addition, I'm going to paint a few pictures for my room, I like painting very much!

senses.sense: finally, after something has been thought about or discussed a lot
senses.dict_examp: We were thinking about going to Switzerland, but in the end we went to Austria.
senses.lear_examp: He wrote me about his plans for the future but in the end he invited me to go to France with him.

senses.sense: including or considering all the information about something or every part of something
senses.dict_examp: We haven't discussed the matter in detail yet.
senses.lear_examp: I'm really sorry that I didn't write back earlier, but to make up for this I will answer your questions in detail!

senses.sense: completely and with nothing missing
senses.dict_examp: The bill must be paid in full by the end of the month.
senses.lear_examp: On the whole, I would like to say that the lessons together with the social events will show daily life at my school in full.

senses.sense: beginning from now
senses.dict_examp: Could you be more careful in the future?
senses.lear_examp: I hope to see it again and I'll be more careful in the future with my objects.

senses.sense: usually, or in most situations
senses.dict_examp: In general, men are taller than women.
senses.lear_examp: In general I like reading in my free time, when I have nothing to do...

senses.sense: crying
senses.dict_examp: I found him in tears in his bedroom.
senses.lear_examp: By the end of it, Mary Anne was nearly in tears.

senses.sense: with the purpose of achieving something
senses.dict_examp: He came home early in order to see the children before they went to bed.
senses.lear_examp: She will go to the United States in order to improve her English.

senses.sense: expressed or written in a particular way
senses.dict_examp: They spoke in Russian the whole time.
senses.lear_examp: I also speak in English during the break.

senses.sense: especially
senses.dict_examp: Are you looking for anything in particular?
senses.lear_examp: I've read a lot of books recently, and in particular I liked: "Eleven minutes" and "Veronica decides to die", written by Paulo Coelho.

senses.sense: involved or connected with a particular subject or activity
senses.dict_examp: a degree in philosophy
senses.lear_examp: He is my age and we have the same tastes in music and art.

senses.sense: because of a possibility of something happening, being needed, etc.
senses.dict_examp: I don't think I'll need any money but I'll bring some just in case.
senses.lear_examp: You can't forget to bring comfortable shoes in case you have to walk long distances while you are sightseeing.

senses.sense: when something happens, or in preparation for when something happens
senses.dict_examp: We keep a bucket of water backstage, in case of fire.
senses.lear_examp: It is about how to rescue people in case of an accident or a natural disaster.

senses.sense: considering the whole of someone or something, and not just a particular part of them
senses.dict_examp: So, apart from the bad ankle, how are you in general?
senses.lear_examp: I think that I, as well as people in general, would have been more depressed if we didn't have light.

senses.sense: to agree with or approve of a plan or idea
senses.dict_examp: Most people are in favor of reducing traffic in cities.
senses.lear_examp: I am more in favor of longer opening hours during the week, and of shorter ones on the weekend.

senses.sense: divided into two equal parts
senses.dict_examp: Cut the potatoes in two.
senses.lear_examp: They were very surprised when they found the gold was cut in half.

senses.sense: used to emphasize what is really true, or to give more information
senses.dict_examp: I thought she was Portuguese, but in actual fact she's Brazilian.
senses.lear_examp: Nowadays almost all people own a car and in actual fact more and more people have been facing death as a consequence of careless driving.

senses.sense: used to give another reason for something you are saying, or that you have done
senses.dict_examp: I don't want to go and in any case, I haven't been invited.
senses.lear_examp: In any case I will meet you at the opening party at the end of the month.

senses.sense: because of the mentioned situation
senses.dict_examp: There's no coffee left? In that case I'll have tea.
senses.lear_examp: You could try kayaking. In that case, of course, you need to pay for the equipment.

senses.sense: used to show the total amount of something
senses.dict_examp: Some of the children came, so there were 15 of us in all.
senses.lear_examp: Secondly, even though most people liked the group RADIANT, they only played for 35 minutes in all.

senses.sense: used when referring to something that is done as a result of something else

senses.lear_examp: I am writing to you in response to your advertisement of 1st December in the Times.

senses.sense: using only a few words
senses.dict_examp: world news in brief
senses.lear_examp: Now I will tell you in brief what exactly happened to me.

senses.sense: in someone's opinion
senses.dict_examp: In my parents' eyes, I'll always be a child.
senses.lear_examp: To answer your question right away, the boat trip is highly recommendable in my eyes!

senses.sense: used to introduce the last part of a speech or a piece of writing
senses.dict_examp: In conclusion, I would like to thank our guest speaker for her fascinating talk.
senses.lear_examp: In conclusion, music, TV and clothes are very important in a young person's life and can reflect each person's character.

senses.sense: used to say what something is about
senses.dict_examp: I am writing in connection with the above job advertised in The Daily Press on Monday 12th February.
senses.lear_examp: Dear Mrs Brown, I am writing in connection with a surprise birthday party for your husband, Mr Brown.

senses.sense: at a suitable time in the future
senses.dict_examp: The results will be sent to you in due course.
senses.lear_examp: I look forward to hearing from you in due course.

senses.sense: toward someone
senses.dict_examp: She keeps looking in my direction.
senses.lear_examp: I didn't know why she was talking to me but suddenly she walked in my direction and told me: "I need to know your name".

senses.sense: used to explain what something means in a different way
senses.dict_examp: He said he's too busy - in other words he isn't interested.
senses.lear_examp: They had had a great time before and had drunk too much alcohol. In other words, they were totally drunk.

senses.sense: An agreement that is in writing is official and is proof of that agreement.
senses.dict_examp: Please confirm your reservation in writing.
senses.lear_examp: I am telling you in writing that I would like to help you.

senses.sense: if vegetables or fruit are in season, they are available and ready to eat.
senses.dict_examp: Asparagus is in season at the moment.
senses.lear_examp: They celebrate Halloween in October when pumpkins are in season, that's why in the decorations they include them very often; most of the people carve the pumpkins and put some lights inside.

senses.sense: without telling other people
senses.dict_examp: For years they met in secret.
senses.lear_examp: We met in secret when Mary was busy.

senses.sense: feeling good/excited/unhappy, etc.
senses.dict_examp: The whole class was in good spirits that day.
senses.lear_examp: I was in high spirits until I got my paper back.

senses.sense: because of
senses.dict_examp: In view of recent events, we have decided to cancel the meeting.
senses.lear_examp: In view of what happened, I would advise you not to try to mislead people like this again.

senses.sense: in order to celebrate or show great respect for someone or something
senses.dict_examp: a banquet in honor of the president
senses.lear_examp: Besides, if you come these days you will see the local fiesta at which the local people celebrate special events in honor of our saints.

senses.sense: If you do something in person, you go somewhere to do it yourself.
senses.dict_examp: You have to collect the document in person.
senses.lear_examp: I am looking forward to meeting you in person.

senses.sense: instead of something

senses.sense: If you do something in memory of a dead person, you do it to show your respect or love for them.

senses.sense: in your imagination or memory

senses.sense: If bad things are done in the name of something, they are done in order to help that thing succeed.

senses.sense: combined into a single thing

senses.sense: partly

senses.sense: when things are in perspective, you think about them in a sensible and  realistic way, and understand how important or unimportant they really are

senses.sense: in the correct position

senses.sense: If a rule, system, etc. is in place, it has started to exist.

senses.sense: used to mean that something is very likely

senses.sense: If something changes in proportion to another thing, it changes to the same degree as that thing.

senses.sense: the person or thing that is being discussed

senses.sense: thinking back to something that happened  before

senses.sense: in a bad situation where you do the same things all the time, or where it is impossible to make progress

senses.sense: to be acceptable in a way that will not upset or anger people

senses.sense: to be unacceptable in a way that will upset or anger people

senses.sense: in a direct and often angry way

senses.sense: to understand what someone wants or needs or to understand a situation and act in a way that is suitable for it

senses.sense: used to say that someone or something does something to a large degree

senses.sense: to be likely to happen

senses.lear_examp: Of course I was able to purchase a second-hand one but I thought that it was a good investment to have a new computer provided with up-to-date software.

senses.sense: to do things and be part of an activity or event
senses.dict_examp: How did you get involved in acting?
senses.lear_examp: According to your letter, you want to encourage more people to get involved in the swimming club and the chess club.

senses.sense: to try to discover all the facts about something, especially a crime or accident
senses.dict_examp: Police are investigating allegations of corruption involving senior executives.
senses.lear_examp: John, who was the husband of Julia, went to his office and started investigating the kidnapping.

senses.sense: to give money to a bank, business, etc., or buy something, because you hope to get a profit
senses.dict_examp: The institute will invest 5 million in the project.
senses.lear_examp: However, you could invest the extra money in the infrastructure.

senses.sense: to use a lot of time, effort, or emotions because you want to succeed
senses.dict_examp: You have all invested significant amounts of time and energy in making this project the success that it is.
senses.lear_examp: So, investing a bit of time and care on yourself might be the reason for your 90th birthday party!

senses.sense: the action of telling someone another person's name the first time that they meet
senses.dict_examp: You'll have to do/make the introductions - I don't know everyone's name.
senses.lear_examp: As we didn't know each other, the meeting started with the introduction of everybody.

senses.sense: the opening text of a book, speech, article, etc.
senses.dict_examp: Read the introduction to the article and decide what it will be about.
senses.lear_examp: Report introduction: The purpose to this report is to give suggestions of how to make the reception area more welcoming for everyone.

senses.sense: when you make something exist, happen or be used for the first time
senses.dict_examp: The introduction of new working practices has dramatically improved productivity.
senses.lear_examp: With the introduction of the computer, we can now access the Internet to communicate with our relatives and friends living abroad.

senses.sense: a book or course which provides basic knowledge about a subject
senses.dict_examp: an introduction to psychology
senses.lear_examp: Please send me some information about your club and tell me about courses like "an introduction to flying".

senses.sense: the first time someone experiences something
senses.dict_examp: It was our first introduction to great poetry.
senses.lear_examp: In 1998 it was the first introduction to home internet access and as we can see from the chart, less than 10% of people had one at home.

senses.sense: when someone invites you to do something or go somewhere
senses.dict_examp: Thanks for the invitation to your birthday party.
senses.lear_examp: Thank you for your invitation.

senses.sense: something that is likely to cause a particular result, especially a bad one
senses.dict_examp: Leaving your house unlocked is an open invitation to burglars.
senses.lear_examp: This was hard to resist for computer programmers who understood it as an invitation to try and fool the examiner with a cunning computer program.

senses.sense: a person who puts money into a bank, business, etc.  in order to make a profit
senses.dict_examp: A New York investor offered to acquire the company's stock for $13 a share.
senses.lear_examp: This should be done by lowering taxes and preparing other incentives for potential investors.

senses.sense: Irrational feelings and actions are based on your emotions and not on good reasons.
senses.dict_examp: irrational behavior
senses.lear_examp: It was an irrational fear, but try to explain this to a five-year-old girl who constantly dreamt about vampire dolls killing her while she was unable to move!

senses.sense: If a situation or activity involves something, that thing is a necessary part of it.
senses.dict_examp: The trips often involve a lot of walking.
senses.lear_examp: It is a competition for schools and it involves many kinds of sport.

senses.sense: to affect or include someone or something in an activity
senses.dict_examp: The second accident involved two cars and a truck.
senses.lear_examp: She had written me to tell me that our friends Todd and Alice had died in an strange accident that involved a vacuum cleaner.

senses.sense: to make someone be part of an activity or process
senses.dict_examp: I prefer teaching methods that actively involve students in learning.
senses.lear_examp: Trying to involve children and young people in general, interactive activities could be really successful.

senses.sense: someone who enters a place where they are not allowed to be, often to commit a crime
senses.dict_examp: I heard intruders at the back of the house.
senses.lear_examp: The Police Department did accept that the Jouzalez house was not robbed, but only showed signs of mess and disorder, as if the intruders were looking for something specific, for a certain document.

senses.sense: someone who goes to a place or  becomes involved in a situation where others do not want them
senses.dict_examp: I felt like an intruder at their dinner table.
senses.lear_examp: Hooper considered the newcomer to be an intruder, to be subtly persecuted.

senses.sense: used to emphasize that a situation is strange because it is the opposite of what you expected
senses.dict_examp: Ironically, the only good book on this subject has gone out of print.
senses.lear_examp: Either way, food is a big industry and a vital contributor to our culture, but ironically, food is also the biggest problem in the world.

senses.sense: In grammar, an irregular verb, noun, adjective, etc. does not obey the usual rules for words in the language.
senses.dict_examp: a table of irregular verbs

senses.sense: Irregular actions or events happen with a different amount of time between each one.
senses.dict_examp: They met at irregular intervals.
senses.lear_examp: To make matters worse, the meal times are irregular, so as a result I am skinny.

senses.sense: not smooth or straight, or having parts that are different sizes
senses.dict_examp: an irregular coastline
senses.lear_examp: In my hurry, I never saw the irregular floor and I fell over!

senses.sense: Something that is irreversible cannot be changed back to how it was before.
senses.dict_examp: irreversible damage to the heart/lungs
senses.lear_examp: It is important to remember that everything done excessively can have irreversible consequences!

senses.sense: used to say that something does not affect a situation
senses.dict_examp: Everyone should be treated equally, irrespective of skin color.
senses.lear_examp: He demonstrated that irrespective of the political circumstances, art will always go on, it cannot be subdued.

senses.sense: annoyed
senses.dict_examp: Ben began to get increasingly irritated by/with her questions.
senses.lear_examp: Tom noticed that she was irritated about something.

senses.sense: extremely attractive and impossible not to like or want
senses.dict_examp: an irresistible smile
senses.lear_examp: For instance, a perfume might make men irresistible to women, or vice versa.

senses.sense: too powerful to control or ignore
senses.dict_examp: irresistible pressure
senses.lear_examp: From time to time we do feel an irresistible desire to get possession of something that is not a must. We are so tempted that we buy it.

senses.sense: the state of being separate from other people, places, or things
senses.dict_examp: the country's economic isolation from the rest of the world
senses.lear_examp: Due to the isolation, the country had to feed itself with everything which was needed.

senses.sense: alone, or separately from other people, places, or things
senses.dict_examp: These poems cannot be considered in isolation.
senses.lear_examp: In conclusion, it is my opinion that the problem of parking space cannot be solved in isolation.

senses.sense: a feeling of being lonely
senses.dict_examp: I had this awful sense of isolation.
senses.lear_examp: Unemployment can lead to isolation.

senses.sense: a piece of land completely surrounded by water
senses.dict_examp: a desert island
senses.lear_examp: I'm on the island of Aruba.

senses.sense: not thinking about the possible bad results of what you are doing
senses.dict_examp: irresponsible behavior
senses.lear_examp: You can't always rely on the drivers, who are sometimes irresponsible and careless.

senses.sense: used to refer to the thing, situation, or idea that has already been talked about
senses.dict_examp: "Where's my pen?" "You left it by the phone."
senses.lear_examp: This is a very beautiful place and I like it.

senses.sense: used as the subject or object of a verb to represent a phrase at the end of the sentence
senses.dict_examp: I liked it in Scotland.
senses.lear_examp: It's a nice place.

senses.sense: used to talk about the time, date, weather or distances
senses.dict_examp: What time is it?
senses.lear_examp: It rained and rained and rained and it really didn't want to stop raining.

senses.sense: used as the subject of verbs such as "seem," "appear," and "look"
senses.dict_examp: It seemed unfair to leave her at home.
senses.lear_examp: It seemed fantastic but we knew our parents would never agree.

senses.sense: used to say the name of a person or thing when the person you are speaking to does not know
senses.dict_examp: It's your Dad on the phone.

senses.sense: used to emphasize one part of a sentence
senses.dict_examp: It's the children I'm concerned about, not me.

senses.sense: the reflexive form of the pronoun "it"
senses.dict_examp: The cat licked itself all over.

senses.sense: alone or without help
senses.dict_examp: The dog was in the house by itself for several days.
senses.lear_examp: If an animal is kept by itself, with no-one to keep it company, it gets lonely and very sad.

senses.sense: used to put emphasis on a word
senses.dict_examp: The shop itself started 15 years ago but the mail-order side of the business is new.
senses.lear_examp: There are lots of trees and bushes,  but the city itself is quite ugly.

senses.sense: used emphasize that something is true of one particular thing but that other things may have to be considered
senses.dict_examp: The plan wasn't illegal in itself but it would lead to some doubtful practices.
senses.lear_examp: To begin with, a car, in my opinion, can't be harmful in itself.

senses.sense: information technology: the use of computers and other electronic equipment to store and send information
senses.dict_examp: He's a project manager for a large IT company.
senses.lear_examp: I want to study I.T. because it is very useful.

senses.sense: making you feel annoyed
senses.dict_examp: an irritating habit
senses.lear_examp: In conclusion, like all things in life, shopping can be pleasant or irritating depending on your patience and on your mood that day.

senses.sense: a single thing in a set or on a list
senses.dict_examp: the last item on the list
senses.lear_examp: I have tasted all the items in that restaurant.

senses.sense: a piece of news on television or radio, or in a newspaper
senses.dict_examp: a small item on the back page of the local newspaper
senses.lear_examp: Last week, in the "East London Journal", I read an item about your opening an Investor Club.

senses.sense: the feeling of being annoyed, or something that makes you annoyed
senses.dict_examp: minor irritations
senses.lear_examp: In the daytime, the noise leads to irritation.

senses.sense: a long way from other places
senses.dict_examp: an isolated village in the mountains
senses.lear_examp: You might get lost in an isolated region without anyone to help you.

senses.sense: alone and not having help or support from other people
senses.dict_examp: Kazuo felt very isolated at his new school.
senses.lear_examp: Before you even know it, you'll feel isolated and alone because other people will have forgotten about you.

senses.sense: a case/event/example, etc. that happens only once
senses.dict_examp: This robbery was not an isolated incident.
senses.lear_examp: This is just an isolated example among an endless list.

senses.sense: a list of places that you plan to visit on a journey
senses.dict_examp: The President's itinerary includes visits to Boston and New York.
senses.lear_examp: Finally, although the itinerary involved a visit to St. Andrews, for some unknown reasons we never went there and I was really disappointed.

senses.sense: becoming annoyed very easily
senses.dict_examp: Jack's been irritable all day.
senses.lear_examp: Lord Trimingham remains calm throughout the story whereas Ted Burgess seems quite irritable and impulsive.

senses.sense: to annoy someone
senses.dict_examp: His comments really irritated me.
senses.lear_examp: Children get hyperactive and irritate other passengers.

senses.sense: belonging to or relating to something that has already been mentioned
senses.dict_examp: The dog hurt its paw.
senses.lear_examp: When you touch it, a light bulb appears on its screen.

senses.sense: a subject or problem which people are thinking and talking about
senses.dict_examp: environmental/moral/personal issues
senses.lear_examp: You're a student so this should be a very important issue for you.

senses.sense: the newspaper, magazine, etc. that is produced on a particular day/week/month
senses.dict_examp: Have you seen the latest issue of Computer World?
senses.lear_examp: Having seen your advertisement in the 4th issue of Asahi News, I hasten to write this letter.

senses.sense: to disagree with what someone says or writes
senses.dict_examp: Isn’t the need to hire more staff  what’s really at issue here.
senses.lear_examp: On behalf of the staff who worked for this event, I would like to take issue with the report's inaccuracies and unfair remarks.

senses.sense: most important in what is being discussed
senses.dict_examp: The point at issue is what is best for the child.
senses.lear_examp: I wouldn't like to fall into the trap of generalizing the matter at issue, but I believe there are two ways of traveling.

senses.sense: to officially say something or give someone something
senses.dict_examp: The office will be issuing parking permits on Tuesday and Thursday mornings.
senses.lear_examp: Finally, the doctors issued an ultimatum.

senses.sense: If a part of your body itches, it feels uncomfortable and you want to rub it with your nails.
senses.dict_examp: Woollen sweaters make my arms itch.
senses.lear_examp: On the other hand I loathe jumpers since they make me itch, so I buy them once in a blue moon!

senses.sense: to want to do something very much
senses.dict_examp: You could tell that they were itching to leave.
senses.lear_examp: The difference between these two kinds of people lies exactly there: the package-tourist is itching to go back home as soon as he sets off whereas the traveler may never go back home.
